Run, Think, Shoot, Live. Sums up this game to a T. great boomer shooter well worth playing today if you don't mind the dated graphics. Gordon controls like he is made out of soap so when the game asks you to platform its kinda annoying and can lead to many unfair deaths, however, because of the super fast movement you can do things they you can't in other fps of this era and latter. In half life you can run up to an enemy shoot him with the shot gun move back behind cover throw a grenade run back shoot him with the revolver then throw bugs at him.

This was not my first time playing through this game; however, it was been a long time since my last play through and I have mixed emotions towards this game. While yes, I do recommend this game and it is one the most revolutionary games to date, that's not to say that it is not without flaw. The bad. Many times I found myself frustrated on the lack of clear directions, as well with how "slippery" the movement felt. This made moments in the story that required precise jumping and movement annoying to deal with. On top of that, the amount of times I died to random environmental events, as well as glitches where my player was stuck has become too many to count and that also frustrated me. The good. The story, atmosphere, and world-building of the disastrous 'Resonance Cascade Event' was amazing. I love the Half-Life franchise and the way Valve managed to truly bring the scope of this event to life was amazing. The 'run and gun' type game play is very fun and satisfying at times, the game makes you feel at the center of the action.  Overall, I would give Half-Life one an 8/10, highly recommended.

[h1] My thoughts: 10/10 [/h1]

I know it's kinda corny to rate a game a 10, you'd probably see a 9 more often, but just... wow.
The story, soundtrack, and gameplay is just pure amazing, [b]EVEN[/b] for a game in the 90's.
It's a really fun experience, but most of the time, the game doesn't tell where you're supposed to go, so you might have to look up a walkthrough or something.
If you're having trouble picking [b]Half-Life[/b] or [b]Half-Life: Source[/b]... it's really your choice. Source has some improvements, but it also has its flaws. In my opinion, I would get Half-Life.
Anyways, if you really liked playing this game, I would recommend getting the [b]Half-Life Complete Pack[/b] or [b]The Orange Box[/b]!
https://store.steampowered.com/bundle/231/HalfLife_Complete/
https://store.steampowered.com/sub/469/
Either way, this game is a must have.
